data.title: Windows code signing: please add a timestamp
data.body:
Hi,

This is related to #1034 and #2813.

It'd be cool if the Authenticode signature on atom.exe was timestamped, since this would allow the signature to continue to be deemed valid even after the Not After date of the code signing certificate.

An example of this gone wrong is Sublime Text 2, which is signed without a timestamp, and the certificate that was used for the signature has since expired:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/36527/3528409/07330076-078f-11e4-869a-465aa1873f47.png)

data.title: Enabling the 'Use React Editor' option causes ligatures not to render with Hasklig font
data.body:
I have my `styles.less` set up so that it renders the [Hasklig font](https://github.com/i-tu/Hasklig)'s ligatures:

``` css
.editor {
    text-rendering: optimizeLegibility;
}
```

This is with the 'Use React Editor' option unchecked in the settings:

![Without React](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/695077/3526878/c7be5f58-077f-11e4-8939-62988188cffa.png)

When I enable the React option and close/reopen the file the ligatures no longer render:

![With React](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/695077/3526903/046d0396-0780-11e4-974e-93822e35e9e9.png)

This only occurs when opening old files. A new React editor will render the ligatures fine as you type.

Interestingly the `::` operator alone renders ok in all instances when in React mode.

data.title: window:save-all touches all the opened files
data.body: Due to https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1690 now when you call `window:save-all`, all the files opened by the editor get touched. That is definitely not a good idea, since it can trigger file watcher for files that didn't change, and it can cause performance problems when you have a lot of files open and you are working on a slow disk, or with third party programs that monitor your filesystem (Dropbox, anyone?)

data.title: Register split or close action
data.body:
It is currently possible to register an opener for a URI but nothing is available for split or close actions. This would be useful if you want to prevent splitting for specific panes or change the behaviour when it is split. 

**Use case**
A user just reported [a bug for my Ask Stack package](https://github.com/Chris911/Ask-Stack-Atom/issues/8) where nothing is rendered when you split an answers view and it is not possible to close that pane afterwards. By design, there should always only be 1 answer view so I would like to prevent splitting that pane or at least have a little bit of control when if it happens.

data.title: displayBuffers not destroyed properly
data.body:
1. open a file (let's call it id `1`)
2. open another file (lets give this one id `2`)
3. split the file with `cmd-shift-|` (this one can be id `3`)
4. close the file just split in the first split (editor with id `2`)
5. try to paste or add new lines to the end of the file

You will get one of two errors:

![screen shot 2014-07-08 at 3 52 06 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3518205/19961d68-06fc-11e4-9249-b5cce01a6e15.png)

Or the same error originating from `git-diff`. 

@nathansobo and I stepped through this, and the error happens in the displayBuffer assigned to the file that was closed (id `2` in the above example). The `displayBuffer` and it's markers are not being destroyed properly when closed.

data.title: Streamline character width remeasurement to hopefully avoid exceptions
data.body: Previously, I was just remeasuring characters whenever the stylesheets changed. I think there were situations in which the model changed, then I remeasured characters prior to updating the view to match the model, causing DOM exceptions. This switches the approach to only ever measure characters after an update, ensuring the view always matches the model.

data.title: Characters are measured as 0 width when editor is hidden during theme change
Move serialization of active pane from Pane to PaneContainer
data.body:
Fixes #2694
Fixes #2853

Previously, we were storing an `active` boolean for each pane. We've had some strange bugs where every pane is serializing `active: false`, which causes exceptions when loading up the stored data.

This new approach serializes the activePaneId on the PaneContainer itself. Since the PaneContainer is the source of truth regarding the active pane, it makes more sense to handle it here.

This unfortunately changes the serialization version for the PaneContainer, so people won't have their pane state persisted after upgrading. But it seems better than leaving cruft to handle the old serialization situation.

/cc @kevinsawicki since this is a critical change.
